h3.a: New student registration update for 2020-21 school year

div.span: Due to the ongoing regulations surrounding COVID-19, NCS is not currently finalizing registrations for the 2020-21 school year. This is for incoming kindergarten through 12th grade students. The online forms system is still available, and parents can fill forms out at any time. We will not be making appointments to finalize your student's registration until a later time — at least after May 1, if not later. Student registration for the current school year (2019-20) is still available. Please visit our student registration page by clicking here.

It has been a wonderful first week of blended learning in the Newark City School District. Earlier this week, Governor DeWine extended the school closure and stay-at-home order to May 1. Our goal as a district during this time is to help students learn from home without overwhelming families. We know that this is a stressful time, and we don’t want to add to that stress level. If you need additional support, please reach out to your child’s teacher or additional contacts that you may have. We have technical support numbers available on our website’s Blended Learning page, as well.

span.div: We will be starting Zoom Video Tutoring. The first session will be March 18th from 8- 11 AM and again from 1-3 PM.

h3.a: UPDATED APRIL 5: School Lunch sites during school closure

div.span: Newark City Schools will be offering grab-and-go breakfast and lunch packs from more than 20 locations across Newark. The meals will be available from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. every weekday. Please click here for a list of locations, organized by school attendance area. Families can visit any spot that is most convenient. The sites were updated on April 5. We are no longer serving meals at the following locations: Liberty Middle School, the Maintenance and Transportation Warehouse, the Administration Service Center, the Skate Park or Don Edwards, due to low demand.

We have had a lot of requests for devices for families who need them. Your building principal will be contacting you with information about where and when to pick the device up. Please have patience as we try to get devices to you in the most efficient way possible. Please don’t go to your building to get a device unless you have been contacted by a building principal. As we prepare for posting our first week of class lessons online, I am reminded of a saying: School is not a place: It’s what is taking place. We have a lot of great opportunities for student learning during this time. Educating at home can be a positive thing.

We wanted to remind families that we are still providing our lunch and breakfast meals at our elementary buildings and the Administration Service Center this week from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Even though the governor has issued a stay-at-home order across the state, we are able to provide these meals. We do encourage families to pick up multiple days’ worth of meals so that you don’t need to make trips every day. As we said last week, we are able to make devices available for families who need them. If you need a device for your home, please contact your building principal by email with the names of your children, what schools they attend and your current address and phone numbers. We will begin giving the devices to families on Thursday and Friday from 10 to 1. Your principal will be getting in touch with you on when and where to pick them up.

h3.a: NCS to pay staff during closure following Board action

div.span: The Newark City School District will continue compensation of all regular employees throughout the current mandatory school closure, after the Board of Education passed a resolution during a special meeting on Thursday. The board has authorized district Treasurer Julio Valladares to pay all regular employees, aides and substitutes until the governor ends the mandatory school closure, or the authorization is withdrawn by the board.
